title: About
text: A junior sports media major at the University of Nebraska-Lincoln.

title: Just how good was Brice Williams’ 2024-25 campaign?
text:
Despite coming up short of a second consecutive NCAA Tournament bid, Nebraska’s Brice Williams was absolutely phenomenal for the Cornhuskers, leading them to claim the inaugural College Basketball Crown Championship. On the way to the championship, Williams set the Nebraska single season record.


Code
PointsTable <- read.csv("data/PointsLeader.csv")

PointsTable |> 
  gt() |>
  cols_label(
    X = "Rank",
    Points.Per.Game = "PPG",
    Total.Points = "Total Points",
    Name = "Player"
  ) |>
  tab_header(
    title = "Brice Williams solidifies himself as a Husker great",
    subtitle = "Brice Williams finished the 2024-25 campaign with the highest single season points total in Nebraska history, while averaging the sixth most points per game."
  ) |> 
  tab_style(
    style = cell_text(color = "black", weight = "bold", align = "left"),
    locations = cells_title("title")
  ) |>
  tab_style(
    style = cell_text(color = "black", align = "left"),
    locations = cells_title("subtitle")
  ) |>
   tab_source_note(
    source_note = md("**By:** Cole Eastwood  |  **Source:** [Sports Reference](https://www.sports-reference.com/cbb/schools/nebraska/men/leaders-and-records)")
  ) |>
  tab_style(
     locations = cells_column_labels(columns = everything()),
     style = list(
       cell_borders(sides = "bottom", weight = px(3)),
       cell_text(weight = "bold", size=13)
     )
   ) |>
  opt_row_striping() |> 
  opt_table_lines("none") |>
   tab_style(
    style = list(
      cell_fill(color = "red"),
      cell_text(color = "white")
      ),
    locations = cells_body(
      rows = Name == "Brice Williams")
  )

Brice Williams finished the 2024-25 campaign with the highest single season points total in Nebraska history, while averaging the sixth most points per game.

By: Cole Eastwood | Source: Sports Reference








In his final collegiate game, Williams was able to set the Nebraska single-season scoring record. The senior got it done at all levels, at the rim, mid-range, beyond the arc and from the free throw line. This was a common theme throughout the season and made him a matchup nightmare for opposing defenses.
What makes Williams’ scoring outburst even more impressive was his efficiency. The guard continued


Code
BigTenData <- read_csv("data/BigTenData2025.csv")


New names:
Rows: 258 Columns: 30
── Column specification
──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── Delimiter: "," chr
(3): Player, Team, Pos dbl (27): Rk, G, GS, MP, FG...8, FGA, FG...10, 3P, 3PA,
3P%, 2P, 2PA, 2P%, e...
ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data. ℹ
Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.
• `FG` -> `FG...8`
• `FG` -> `FG...10`


Code
BigTenData50 <- BigTenData |>
  head(50)

BriceWilliams <- BigTenData |>
  filter(Player == "Brice Williams")

ggplot() + 
  geom_point(
    data=BigTenData50, 
    aes(x=PTS, y=eFG, size=USG), 
    color="grey", 
    alpha=.5) + 
  geom_point(
    data=BriceWilliams, 
    aes(x=PTS, y=eFG, size=USG), 
    color="red") +
  geom_vline(xintercept = 14.648, color = "black") + 
  geom_hline(yintercept = 0.54188, color = "black") +
  geom_text_repel(
    data=BriceWilliams, 
    aes(x=PTS, y=eFG, label=Player)) +
  labs(
    x="Points Per Game",
    y="Effective Field Goal Percentage"
  ) +
  plot_annotation(
        title = "The Big Ten's Leading Scorers",
        subtitle = "Brice Williams sits at second in the conference for points per game, while average in terms of points per game with a high usage rate.",
        caption = "By: Cole Eastwood | Source: Sports Reference"
  ) & 
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 16, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 8), 
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size=8), 
    plot.caption = element_text(face = "bold"),
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank()
  )
